content.description: Very small holds with small razor ledges route is new and is in need of some climbing to reveal the holds Be ware this climb is for the bigg Dawgs.
content.location: Farthest rout to the climbers left

climbs.name: The Pickle Jar
climbs.fa: Jeff Brekenridge, Trevor Taylor, Justin Christiansen. Also equipped by James Garret

content.description: this route in early spring is great but as fall sets in the moss begins to grow directly up the route its quite cool
content.location: 15 ft north of 7 layer bean dip follow the trail and it will bring u right to it hangars are brown

content.description: scramble up to the first bolt from straight below the hangar.once there use the right side and go for the second hangar that is placed over the ledge use a slightly longer quick draw. head to the third once here ur at the Crux Use the triangle on the right with both your right hand and right foot for a fun section. scramble up the ledge left and use the micro crack to traverse back to the right to the chains  Due to recent cleaning the triangle hold is no longer available in this route so find an alternative route
content.location: 6.7 miles past the golf course park and walk across the downed log that spans the river. scramble 15 ft up and there she is on the south side of the rd. there are huge cliffs that are right next to the rd just above mars bars crag u cant miss them also look for the two unlisted sport climbs in that area if you find the unlisted climbs go back down the rd a hundred yards or so

climbs.name: 7 Layer Bean Dip
climbs.fa: Matt Taylor & Adam Young, equipped by James Garret and Justin Christiansen

content.description: Third route from the climbers left up the layered arete. slightly overhanging in places
